sentence: McCarthy objected to Republicans being involved in the committee after Pelosi rejected two of his recommended House members from participating on the committee: Ohio Rep. Jim Jordan and Indiana Rep. Jim Banks.
author: Dillon Burroughs
title: Liz Cheney Destroyed In Wyoming GOP Straw Poll By Trump-Backed Candidate

sentence: The event, held at a posh hotel, featured Reps. Jim Jordan (R-Ohio) and Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) and Mark Meadows, Trump’s former White House chief of staff.
author: David Corn
title: Ski in Jackson Hole? You Could Be Hurting Liz Cheney.

sentence: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi last year vetoed putting Rep. Jim Jordan, R-Ohio, and Rep. Jim Banks, R-Ind., on the panel, so House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy pulled his three other GOP picks, leaving Pelosi free to tap Kinzinger and Cheney.
title: RNC censure of Kinzinger, Cheney could backfire for Illinois Republicans

sentence: Make America Great Again!” When Pelosi launched her January 6 committee, McCarthy recommended that Rep. Jim Banks (R-IN) and Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH) serve as Republican members.
author: Ben Zeisloft
title: McCarthy Endorses Cheney’s Republican Challenger

sentence: Hageman’s political team noted that no non-incumbent Republican topped $1.3 million in the final quarter of last year and that only five GOP incumbents cracked that threshold – McCarthy ($3.7M), House Minority Whip Steve Scalise ($2.6M), Rep. Dan Crenshaw of Texas ($2.1M), Cheney ($2M), and Rep. Jim Jordan of Ohio ($1.4M).
author: Paul Steinhauser
title: Trump-backed Cheney primary challenger Hageman hauls in over $1.3 million past three months

sentence: In July, Pelosi objected to two of McCarthy's appointments to the panel—Representatives Jim Jordan of Ohio and Jim Banks of Indiana.
author: Xander Landen
title: Raskin Says 1/6 Committee 'Able to Get Work Done' Thanks to McCarthy Gamble
